org.jtrim.swing.component

Interface ImageListener


  • public interface ImageListener
    The interface for the listeners which are to be notified by the AsyncImageDisplay when its underlying image changes or successfully receives the meta-data of the image.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this listener interface can only be notified from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and therefore does not need to be thread-safe.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this interface does not need to be synchronization transparent but they must be aware that they are called from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onChangeImage(org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataLink<ImageData> imageLink)
      Invoked when the source of the image of an AsyncImageDisplay changes.
      void onReceiveMetaData(ImageMetaData metaData)
      Invoked when the AsyncImageDisplay successfully retrieves the meta-data of the image to be displayed.

    • Method Detail

      • onChangeImage

        void onChangeImage(org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataLink<ImageData> imageLink)
        Invoked when the source of the image of an AsyncImageDisplay changes. This might either be due to setting the image query or due to setting the image address.
        Parameters:
        imageLink - the AsyncDataLink which can be used to retrieve the image. This method may start to fetch the image if it wishes to analyze the image to be displayed. This argument can be null if either the image query or the image address has been set to null.

      • onReceiveMetaData

        void onReceiveMetaData(ImageMetaData metaData)
        Invoked when the AsyncImageDisplay successfully retrieves the meta-data of the image to be displayed. This method might be called multiple times for a single image retrieval as more and more data becomes available. If the meta-data is not available, this method will never be called.
        Parameters:
        metaData - the meta-data of the image to be displayed. This argument cannot be null.
